title: Meningococcal conjugate vaccine Side Effects: Common, Severe, Long Term
description: Learn about the side effects of meningococcal conjugate vaccine, from common to rare, for consumers and healthcare professionals.
cleaned_text: by Drugs.com. Last updated on Mar 21, 2023. Applies to [meningococcal conjugate vaccine](/mtm/meningococcal-conjugate-vaccine.html): intramuscular solution. Other dosage forms: Serious side effects Along with its needed effects, meningococcal conjugate vaccine may cause some unwanted effects. Although not all of these side effects may occur, if they do occur they may need medical attention. Check with your doctor or nurse immediately if any of the following side effects occur while taking meningococcal conjugate vaccine: Rare Incidence not known skin [rash](/health-guide/rash.html) - hoarseness - irritation [joint pain](/cg/osteoarthritis.html), stiffness, or swelling - redness of the skin - swelling of the eyelids, face, lips, hands, or feet - tightness in the chest - troubled breathing or swallowing Other side effects Some side effects of meningococcal conjugate vaccine may occur that usually do not need medical attention. These side effects may go away during treatment as your body adjusts to the medicine. Also, your health care professional may be able to tell you about ways to prevent or reduce some of these side effects. Check with your health care professional if any of the following side effects continue or are bothersome or if you have any questions about them: More common - Difficulty in moving - general feeling of discomfort or illness [headache](/cg/tension-headache.html) [muscle pain](/cg/acl-injury.html) - pain, redness, or swelling at the injection site - unusual tiredness or weakness Rare - Dizziness For Healthcare Professionals Applies to meningococcal conjugate vaccine: intramuscular powder for injection, intramuscular solution. General The most common adverse events were injection site pain, irritability, diarrhea, headache, and [fatigue](/cg/fatigue.html).[ [Ref](#refs)] Local Very common (10% or more): Injection site pain (48.1%), injection site redness (16%), injection site induration (11%) Common (1% to 10%): Injection site swelling, injection Uncommon (0.1% to 1%): Injection site [pruritus](/cg/itchy-skin.html) Postmarketing reports: Injection site reaction, injection site [cellulitis](/cg/cellulitis.html), extensive swelling of the injected limb (frequently associated with [erythema](/health-guide/rash.html), sometimes involving the adjacent joint or swelling of the entire injected limb)[ [Ref](#refs)] Nervous system Very common (10% 10%): Chills, crying reports: Asthenia, impaired [Ref](#refs)] quadrivalent (Advanced [Meningococcal / C / Y and W-135) Diphtheria Conjugate Vaccine](/cdi/meningococcal-groups-a-c-y-and-w-135-diphtheria-conjugate-vaccine.html) Other brands Related treatment guides References 1.
